name: Tall Fescue Grass
climate: Prefers temperate climates with moderate temperatures for healthy growth.
Adaptable to a wide range of climates but thrives in cooler regions.
Tolerates drought better than some cool-season grasses in temperate zones.
Can survive in both humid and semi-arid climates if managed well.
sunlight: Grows best in areas with partial to full sunlight exposure daily.
Requires at least four to six hours of sunlight for optimal growth.
Can tolerate moderate shade but not densely shaded areas.
In shaded conditions, it may experience reduced growth and vigor.
watering: Needs regular watering, especially during dry spells for lush growth.
Ensure soil remains consistently moist but avoid waterlogging.
During warmer months, frequent watering helps maintain health.
Established grass is more drought-tolerant but benefits from irrigation.
soil: Thrives in well-drained soils with medium fertility for optimal growth.
Prefers loamy soil but can adapt to clay or sandy soils if managed.
Regular soil aeration helps prevent compaction and encourages strong roots.
A neutral to mildly acidic pH is ideal for nutrient uptake and health.
extra_care_tip: Mowing should be done regularly to maintain a height of 3-4 inches.
Avoid heavy foot traffic on new growth to help establishment.
Fall fertilization encourages root growth for winter hardiness.
Dethatch and aerate the lawn annually to promote healthy growth.
